diseases package¶

Submodules¶

diseases.models module¶

class diseases.models.AttributeName(*args, **kwargs)¶

The AttributeName Model stores information about the attribute’s name (i.e. ‘gender’, ‘age’)

Parameters:
  • canonical_name – The canonical name of the attribute
  • synonyms – A list of synonyms corresponding to the canonical name
class diseases.models.AttributeTerm(*args, **kwargs)¶

The AttributeTerm Model stores information about the attribute’s term (i.e. ‘male’, ‘female’)

Parameters:
  • canonical_term – The canonical term of the attribute
  • synonyms – A list of synonyms corresponding to the canonical name
  • attribute_name – An AttributeName object corresponding to this term
class diseases.models.AttributeValue(*args, **kwargs)¶

The AttributeValue Model stores information about an attribute term and value pair

Parameters:
  • name – Name of attribute
  • value – Value of attribute
  • sample – Sample this pair links to
  • attribute_name – The attribute name this pair links to (to keep track of the application’s ontology)
class diseases.models.Disease(*args, **kwargs)¶

The Disease Model stores information about a particular disease

Parameters:
  • name – Name of the disease
  • description – A brief description of the disease
class diseases.models.Experiment(*args, **kwargs)¶

The Experiment Model stores information about a particular experiment

Parameters:
  • gse_id – GSE Accession Number
  • gene_format – Either Ensembl IDs or Gene Names
class diseases.models.Gene(*args, **kwargs)¶

The Gene Model stores information about a particular Gene relative to a particular Experiment

Parameters:
  • gene_name – The gene name or Ensembl ID
  • experiment – The experiment this gene is linked to
  • position – The position of this gene in the array of expression values
class diseases.models.Sample(*args, **kwargs)¶

The Sample Model stores information about a particular sample

Parameters:
  • gse_id – TODO
  • sample_gsm – The unique GSM ID for the sample
  • sample_id – The Sample ID
  • count – Array of gene expression values

diseases.views module¶

diseases.views.index(request)¶

Renders the homepage

diseases.views.matchNames(request)¶

Handles matching the attribute names to each other in order to keep a synchronized ontology

diseases.views.matchTerms(request)¶

Handles matching the attribute values to each other in order to keep a synchronized ontology

diseases.views.search(request)¶

Handles the download of meta-data, parsing the gene expression values for the samples, and matching the meta-data to the appropriate samples

diseases.views.syncValues(request)¶

Handles matching the attribute terms and values in the ontology to the attribute terms and values of the samples
